trans-unit.source: Provides properties and methods for defining how a URL maps to a physical file.
You pass an instance of <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler> to the <xref:System.Web.Routing.Route> constructor in order to map a URL of a physical file.
trans-unit.target: Si passa un'istanza di <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler> per il <xref:System.Web.Routing.Route> costruttore per eseguire il mapping di un URL di un file fisico.

trans-unit.source: The <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler> object specifies the virtual path of the physical file and determines whether authorization rules for the physical URL is checked.
trans-unit.target: Il <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler> oggetto specifica il percorso virtuale del file fisico e determina se le regole di autorizzazione per l'URL fisico è selezionato.

trans-unit.source: Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler" /> class.
The virtual path of the physical file for this <see cref="P:System.Web.Routing.RouteData.Route" /> object.
The file must be located in the current application.
Therefore, the path must begin with a tilde (~).
Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler" /> class.
When you use this constructor, the <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.CheckPhysicalUrlAccess%2A> property is set to `true`.
trans-unit.target: Quando si utilizza questo costruttore, il <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.CheckPhysicalUrlAccess%2A> è impostata su `true`.

trans-unit.source: The <paramref name="virtualPath" /> parameter is <see langword="null" /> or is an empty string or does not start with "~/".
The virtual path of the physical file of this <see cref="P:System.Web.Routing.RouteData.Route" /> object.
The file must be located in the current application.
Therefore, the path must begin with a tilde (~).
If this property is set to <see langword="false" />, authorization rules will be applied to the request URL and not to the URL of the physical page.
If this property is set to <see langword="true" />, authorization rules will be applied to both the request URL and to the URL of the physical page.
Initializes a new instance of the <see cref="T:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler" /> class.
By default, the <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.CheckPhysicalUrlAccess%2A> property is `true`.

Therefore, if you want authorization rules to be applied to both the URL of the physical page and to the route URL, you can use the <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.%23ctor%28System.String%29> constructor instead of this constructor.
trans-unit.target: Pertanto, se si desidera che le regole di autorizzazione da applicare all'URL della pagina fisica e l'URL di route, è possibile utilizzare il <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.%23ctor%28System.String%29> costruttore anziché questo costruttore.

trans-unit.source: The <paramref name="virtualPath" /> parameter is <see langword="null" /> or is an empty string or does not start with "~/".
Gets a value that determines whether authorization rules are applied to the physical file's URL.
<see langword="true" /> if authorization is checked for the URL of the physical file that is associated with the route; otherwise, <see langword="false" />.
trans-unit.target: <see langword="true" /> Se l'autorizzazione viene verificata per l'URL del file fisico che viene associato alla route; in caso contrario, <see langword="false" />.

trans-unit.source: The default is <see langword="true" />.

You can set the <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.CheckPhysicalUrlAccess%2A> property when you use the <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.Boolean%29> constructor.
trans-unit.target: È possibile impostare il <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.CheckPhysicalUrlAccess%2A> proprietà quando si utilizza il <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.%23ctor%28System.String%2CSystem.Boolean%29> costruttore.

trans-unit.source: The value of the <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.CheckPhysicalUrlAccess%2A> property determines whether the <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler> object will check security permissions only for the route URL or for both the physical page and the route URL.
trans-unit.target: Il valore di <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.CheckPhysicalUrlAccess%2A> proprietà determina se il <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler> oggetto verificare le autorizzazioni di sicurezza solo per l'URL di route o per la pagina fisica e l'URL di route.

trans-unit.source: When the <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.CheckPhysicalUrlAccess%2A> property is set to `true` (which is its default value), a user must have permission to access both the route URL and the physical URL.
trans-unit.target: Quando il <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.CheckPhysicalUrlAccess%2A> è impostata su `true` (ovvero il valore predefinito), un utente deve disporre dell'autorizzazione per accedere sia l'URL di route e l'URL fisico.

trans-unit.source: When the <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.CheckPhysicalUrlAccess%2A> property is set to `false`, a user requires only permission to access the route URL, and permissions for the physical URL are not checked.
trans-unit.target: Quando il <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.CheckPhysicalUrlAccess%2A> è impostata su `false`, un utente richiede solo l'autorizzazione per accedere all'URL di route e non vengono controllate le autorizzazioni per l'URL fisico.

trans-unit.source: Permissions are defined in the Web.config file, as shown in the following example:
trans-unit.target: Le autorizzazioni vengono definite nel file Web. config, come illustrato nell'esempio seguente:

trans-unit.source: For a request URL that contains `Category/food/show` after the domain name, if the route URL pattern is `Category/{action}/{categoryName}` and the physical page is Categoriespage.aspx, [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] applies the permissions defined in the previous example in one of the following ways:
trans-unit.target: Per un URL della richiesta contenente `Category/food/show` dopo il nome di dominio, se il modello di URL di route è `Category/{action}/{categoryName}` e la pagina fisica è Categoriespage. aspx, [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] applica le autorizzazioni definite nell'esempio precedente in uno dei modi seguenti:

trans-unit.source: If the <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.CheckPhysicalUrlAccess%2A> property is `false`, all users are granted access, because all users are granted access to the URL pattern that starts with `category`.
trans-unit.target: Se il <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.CheckPhysicalUrlAccess%2A> proprietà `false`, tutti gli utenti sono autorizzati, poiché tutti gli utenti sono concesso l'accesso al modello di URL che inizia con `category`.

trans-unit.source: If the <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.CheckPhysicalUrlAccess%2A> property is `true`, only `admin` users are granted access.
trans-unit.target: Se il <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.CheckPhysicalUrlAccess%2A> proprietà `true`, solo `admin` gli utenti hanno accesso.

trans-unit.source: All users have access to the URL pattern that begins with `category`, but only `admin` users have access to the physical page Categoriespage.aspx.
trans-unit.target: Tutti gli utenti hanno accesso al modello di URL che inizia con `category`, ma solo `admin` gli utenti hanno accesso alla pagina fisica Categoriespage. aspx.

trans-unit.source: An object that encapsulates information about the request.
Returns the object that processes the request.
The object that processes the request.
The <paramref name="requestContext" /> parameter is <see langword="null" />.
An object that encapsulates information about the request.
Returns the virtual path of the physical file for the route after substitutions have been applied to any replacement parameters.
The URL of the physical file that was generated from a route.

If the <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.VirtualPath%2A> value does not contain any replacement parameters, the <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.GetSubstitutedVirtualPath%2A> method returns the same value as the <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.VirtualPath%2A> property.
trans-unit.target: Se il <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.VirtualPath%2A> il valore non contiene alcun parametro di sostituzione, il <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.GetSubstitutedVirtualPath%2A> il metodo restituisce lo stesso valore il <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.VirtualPath%2A> proprietà.

trans-unit.source: The <paramref name="requestContext" /> parameter is <see langword="null" />.
Gets the virtual path of the Web page that is associated with this route.
The URL of the Web page, before substitutions have been applied for any replacement parameters.
trans-unit.target: L'URL della pagina Web, prima delle sostituzioni per i parametri di sostituzione.

trans-unit.source: You set the <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.VirtualPath%2A> property in the <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.%23ctor%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> constructor or in the <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.%23ctor%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> constructor.
trans-unit.target: Impostare il <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.VirtualPath%2A> proprietà il <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.%23ctor%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> costruttore o nel <xref:System.Web.Routing.PageRouteHandler.%23ctor%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> costruttore.
